text: Kim Yong-jin (Korean: 김용진; died 2016) was a senior North Korean official. Kim served as North Korea’s education minister, and in 2012 was made a vice- premier. ==Execution== In August 2016, it was reported that he had been executed by firing squad for allegedly displaying a bad attitude at a national meeting and failing to stand upright. Kim was subsequently branded an "anti- party and a counter-revolutionary member" by North Korea’s State Security. The information was confirmed by South Korea's Unification Ministry spokesman, Jeong Joon Hee. ==References== Category:2016 deaths Category:Year of birth missing Category:Workers' Party of Korea politicians Category:Government ministers of North Korea
